intro: Diplazium panamense, commonly known as the Panamanian water fern, is a species of fern native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Diplazium panamense plays a role in maintaining soil stability and supporting local biodiversity.
